I copied all my wallpapers to /usr/share/backgrounds .. but they are still not showing up in the Wallpapers dialog
because of what I just said..., look at the xml files in /usr/share/gnome-background-properties/
there are two files in there ... precise-wallpapers.xml and ubuntu-wallpapers.xml   .... which one should be modified?
neither, you can add your own
but it looks like each and every wallpaper has a section to itself in the xml file ... is there any way to automatically generate this or do you have to write it out manually?
just copy the ubuntu-wallpapers.xml one and add your own <wallpaper> entries (you only need the <name> and <filename> subtags, maybe <options>zoom</options> too)
I have around 50 wallpapers .. that is going to take way too long ... is this really the only way to do it? It used to work so much better in past releases of Ubuntu ... :P
you could automatically generate it, I don't know how to the packages do it, but you could try: apt-get source ubuntu-wallpapers; and take a look, might have scripts
it would be pretty simple to write a python script or whatever to do it as well
this should be possible without having to manually edit xml files or write python scripts - this is a very basic feature which was working previously in Ubuntu and now seems to be broken
then file a bug
